intro: Ceratogonon atriplicifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf ironweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and dark green color, often with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are typically purple to pink, arranged in dense clusters at the top of the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and wetlands.
